subject: RE: [junit] correct order of tests
msgSnippet: So said  Wolfgang Egger  on  2002-11-08 ... I agree. In this case, the extra bit of detail is not very difficult to understand in general, so it is a good
messageBody:
So said Wolfgang Egger on 2002-11-08

>Servus,
>
> This is why when people learn JUnit, they should learn how to
>put a
> test suite together "by hand" first, and realize that the test
>runner
> is actually just automating some of what would otherwise be
>their work.
> It's a little thing, but important.
>
>I'm not sure, if this is everytime the best way.

I agree. In this case, the extra bit of detail is not very difficult to
understand in general, so it is a good candidate for everyone to know.

J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
